The results presented here provide the most detailed analysis to date of how climate change may impact the future distribution of I. scapularis at the expanding northern edge of the ticksâ€™ range.

These results suggest that increases in Lyme disease risk will occur in many parts of southern Canada even under the most optimistic future climate conditions, which emphasizes the need for continuous development and implementation of public health adaptation strategies.
